intro: Coccoloba punctata var. parvifolia, commonly known as the dwarf spinachberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its small, palmate leaves and clusters of bright red or yellow flowers that appear in the summer. It is often found in coastal areas and on limestone soils, showcasing its adaptability to saline and well-drained environments. The fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
